actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of Nov 22, 89 with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 101-231.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 430.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests, Family Farms, and Energy.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands Prior to Referral (Mar 1, 90).
Executive Comment Requested from Interior, USDA.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported adversely (Amended) by the Committee on Agriculture. H. Rept. 547, Part I. Filed late, pursuant to previous special order.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Executive Comment Received from USDA.
Reported adversely (Amended) by the Committee on Agriculture. H. Rept. 547, Part II. Filed late, pursuant to previous special order.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 495.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-634.

Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to effect an exchange of lands between the U.S. Forest Service and the Salt Lake City Corporation within the State of Utah and for other purposes.
short_title: Salt Lake City Watershed Improvement Act of 1990

summary.text: Salt Lake City Watershed Improvement Act of 1990 - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain Federal lands in Utah to the Salt Lake City Corporation in exchange for the conveyance of certain city lands to the Secretary. Provides that the lands acquired by the United States shall be added to the National Forest System. Provides for the protection of valid existing rights appurtenant to lands exchanged under this Act. Requires the city to recognize the designation of the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail over lands acquired by it and manage such lands accordingly. Prohibits the lands or interests under this Act: (1) from being transferred to any entity other than the United States; and (2) from being subject to any form of mineral, energy, or geothermal exploration or development. Authorizes appropriations.
